title.narrative: PREVENTATIVE AND TERTIARY PROTECTION SER

description.narrative: Government, Family Support Centers and FBOs in six focus provinces have increased capacity to deliver core preventive and responsive protection services including case management and referral services by 2017

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Family reunification in emergencies - prevention and response
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Parent/caregiver education and programmes on violence, exploitation and abuse - across the life cycle
Public finance management for child protection
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social and behaviour change communication on violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order human rights affairs
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government, Family Support Centers and FBOs in six focus provinces have increased capacity to deliver core preventive and responsive protection services including case management and referral services by 2017

description.narrative: A feasibility study of the Parenting for Child Development (P4CD) Program revealed achievement in reduction of harsh parenting and spousal abuse, and improvement in family wellbeing in four provinces in which it was piloted. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2017

title.narrative: % of health facilities in two provinces (ABG, WHP) with at least two health workers trained in emergency medical care for survivors

actual.value:
2017:Percentage not available.
63 health facilities (an increase from 9) with at least two trained health workers with capacity to provide comprehensive care.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Targetted parents/primary caregivers reached by programmes addressing child-rearing practices

actual.value: 2017:1200, P4CD Program tested in 10 communities, and parenting program implemented in AROB

title.narrative: # of women and children survivors of violence accessing family support centres

actual.value:
2017:Info. not available.
157 health workers from 54 health facilities serving a catchment population of 374,000 trained in providing care for survivors of family and sexual violence

title.narrative: % of adults in targeted communities who indicate that it is justified to physically punish children

actual.value: 2017:Percentage not available. Feasibility evaluation of P4CD program tested in 10 communities shows that the program resulted in significant reduction in reported harsh treatment of children and violence between spouses.

title.narrative: Proportion of children 6-14 years in targeted communities who experience violent disciplinary practice in the last 12 months

actual.value:
2017:Percentage not available.
Feasibility evaluation of P4CD program, tested in 10 communities, shows that the program resulted in significant reduction in reported harsh treatment of children.
